newsitem.title: USA: US News & World Report names Evans president.
newsitem.headline: US News & World Report names Evans president.

text.p: U.S. News & World Report magazine said Thursday that Tom Evans, its publisher, had been named to the additional post of president.
Evans will be responsible for day-to-day business operations at U.S. News.
Fred Drasner, chief executive officer, retains control of the magazine's overall strategic business direction, U.S. News said.
Evans was most recently executive vice president. He has held the publisher's post since 1992.

Eric Gertler was named executive vice president. He will report to Evans and will oversee a number of U.S. News departments, including finance, manufacturing, distribution, circulation, new media, legal and product extensions.
U.S. News is one of several media properties controlled by Drasner and Mortimer Zuckerman.
Gertler was most recently president of new media for the various media properties controlled by Drasner and Zuckerman.
